intro: Leucocera horrida, commonly known as the rough leucocera, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments.
